job description:
As an Associate Scientist 1 within Illumina's Clinical Genomics Business Unit, you will work as part of a multi-disciplinary Product Development team to develop sequencing based assays for clinical applications.

All About You

Responsibilities:
  • Plan and execute various laboratory activities with limited instruction
  • Design and perform complex experiments, maintain a detailed records, perform data analysis with statistical tests, and prepare data summaries and reports
  • Manage goals and duties within defined target timeframes
Requirements:
  • Solid training and good understanding of basic biochemistry/molecular biology
  • >3 years' lab experience in molecular biology or biochemical techniques, including DNA and RNA applications
  • Product development experience, including assay optimization and reagent development
  • Ability to think critically and work independently and contribute as part of a multidisciplinary team
  • Analytical, detail oriented, organized, efficient, problem solver
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Must have basic knowledge of statistics
  • Must be fluent in use of Microsoft Word, Powerpoint, and Excel
Preferred Skills&Experience
  • Hands-on experience with next generation sequencing technologies (NGS)
  • Hands-on experience with Illumina sequencing instruments and/or library preparation kits strongly preferred
  • Hands-on development or optimization of library preparation kits preferred
  • Experience with bioinformatics including data interpretation preferred
  • Training or experience in the field of oncology desirable
  • Clinical experience such as: IVD product development, Laboratory Developed Tests (LDT), and/or Companion Diagnostics (CDx) desirable
Education:
  • Bachelor's degree in biochemistry, molecular biology, or related field with 4 years industry experience
  • Or, Master's degree in biochemistry, molecular biology, or related field with 2 years industry experience
